fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Competition, Customs, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Digital economy and society, Transport, Climate Action, Borders and Security, Banking and financial services
eu_initiatives: The UGS is active on a variety of files including, among others, free access to markets and trade, maritime piracy and maritime security, MRV, ship recycling, air emissions, seafarers’ rights, Free Trade Agreements, taxation, customs, ports policy, safety and environment issues, competition, sanctions, migration, ocean governance and maritime spatial planning and a host of proposals and regulatory initiatives with an impact on the competitiveness and sustainability of the shipping sector.
organisation_name: Union of Greek Shipowners - ΕΝΩΣΙΣ ΕΛΛΗΝΩΝ ΕΦΟΠΛΙΣΤΩΝ (UGS)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
European Community Shipowners' Associations (ECSA) 
International Chamber of Shipping (ICS)
goals__remit: The UGS, representing the interests of Greek-owned commercial vessels over 3,000 gt under the Greek flag, as well as EU/EEA and third country flags, follows closely and participates actively in the development of shipping policy, regulation and legislation, both at international and EU level. The UGS engages constructively in the formulation of balanced and realistic collective industry positions and recommendations through its active participation in international and European shipping organisations.
